Information: Emission factor representing fugitive emissions of methane from anaerobic decomposition in biogas facilities.
Notes: Default set as mean between wet and dry weight factors from Volume 5, Table 4.1 in IPCC Guidelines for NGHG Inventories.

Information: Emission factor representing emissions of methane from composting of organic materials
Notes: Default set as mean between wet and dry weight factors from Volume 5, Table 4.1 in IPCC Guidelines for NGHG Inventories.

Information: Based on IPCC Tier 1 approach--:math:`\text{CH}_4` emissions from incineration or open burning of ISW.
Notes: Nominal value is mean across all types of incineration technology and open burning (6500g/t waste) (Volume 5, Table 5.3), or 998.7 g/tonne. This is rounded up to 1 kg/tonne, or 0.001 kg/kg.

Information: Based on IPCC Tier 1 approach--:math:`\text{CH}_4` emissions from incineration or open burning of MSW.
Notes: Nominal value is mean across all types of incineration technology and open burning (6500g/t waste) (Volume 5, Table 5.3), or 998.7 g/tonne. This is rounded up to 1 kg/tonne, or 0.001 kg/kg.

Information: Factor representing how much methane is extracted from landfill gas that is recovered.
Emission factor representing emissions of nitrus oxide from composting of organic materials
Notes: Default is set as mean between wet and dry weight factors from Volume 5, Table 4.1 in IPCC Guidelines for NGHG Inventories.

Variable: Average Annual Waste Transported Per Waste Collection Vehicle
Information: Average annual total waste collected per waste collection vehicle. Used to calculate a marginal increase in heavy transport transportation demand resulting from an increase in waste collection, which is passed to the transportation model.

Variable: Average Methane Correction Factor at Landfills
Information: The Methane Correction Factor represents different management approaches for solid waste disposal at landfills. See Volume 5, Chapter 3, Table 3.1 of IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories for default MCFs.

Variable: Average Methane Correction Factor for Open Dumping
Information: The Methane Correction Factor represents different management approaches for solid waste disposal at landfills. See Volume 5, Chapter 3, Table 3.1 of IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories for default MCFs.

Oxidization factor (see V5, C3, Table 3.2) for landfills. The oxidization factor represents a practice at well-managed landfills of covering landfills with with :math:`\text{CH}_4` oxidising material--e.g., soild or compost. Should not exceed 0.1.

Variable: Average VKMT Per Waste Collection Vehicle
Information: Average annual Vehicle Kilometers Traveled (VKMT) per waste collection vehicle. Used to calculate a marginal increase in heavy transport transportation demand resulting from an increase in waste collection, which is passed to the transportation model.
Factor representing faction of biogas recovered for energy production. Recovery of biogass prevents emissions.

Variable: Fraction of ISW Incineration Recovered for Energy
Information: Incineration can be open burning or for energy. This fraction :math:`a` represents the how much ISW is incinerated for energy production. :math:`1 - a` is then assumed to be some mix of open burning and icineration. Incinerable waste can be passed to the Energy model as a Fuel.

Variable: Fraction of Landfill Gas Recovered at Landfills
Information: Represents the proportion of methane emitted at landfills that is captured. This represents an average over the country across all landfills, as SISEPUEDE does not distinguish between sanitary landfills, controlled landfills, or other landfills.

Variable: Fraction of Landfill Gas Recovered for Energy
Information: Landfil gas can be captured and converted to energy. This fraction :math:`a` represents the how much landfil gas that is *captured* is converted to energy. :math:`1 - a` is then assumed to be recovered and not converted to energy (or flared). Landfill gas can be passed to the Energy model as a Fuel.

Variable: Fraction of Methane Flared at Composting Facilities
Fraction of MSW Incineration Recovered for Energy
Information: Incineration can be open burning or for energy. This fraction :math:`a` represents the how much MSW is incinerated for energy production. :math:`1 - a` is then assumed to be some mix of open burning and icineration. Incinerable waste can be passed to the Energy model as a Fuel.

Variable: Fraction of Non-Recycled Solid Waste Incinerated
Information: Proportion of non-recycled municipal waste that is burned in incineration facilities and in open burn sites.

Variable: Fraction of Non-Recycled Solid Waste Landfilled
Information: Proportion of non-recycled municipal waste that is landfilled. Landfills include different levels of management

Variable: Fraction of Non-Recycled Solid Waste Open Dumps
Information: Proportion of non-recycled municipal waste that is ends up in open dumpsites
Fraction of waste in category ``CAT-WASTE-SOLID`` composted. This value should be :math:`\in [0, 1]`.
Fraction of waste in category ``CAT-WASTE-SOLID`` that is recycled. This value should be :math:`\in [0, 1]`.
Fraction of waste in category ``CAT-WASTE-SOLID`` treated anaerobically. This value should be :math:`\in [0, 1]`.

Variable: Historical Back Projection Growth Rate in Solid Waste Generation
Information: Primary a calibration parameter if using the back-projection method for solid waste. The growth rate at time :math:`t = 0` is applied backwards to estimate waste landfilled in previous years. The back projection method should only be used in the absence of historical data.

Variable: Initial Per Capita Municipal Solid Waste Generated
Information: Represents the estimated quantity, in kg/person, of solid waste generated per person at time :math:`t = 0`. The total waste generated per person is then estimated for each waste composition category using the elasticity of waste production to income (GDP/Capita).
Notes: Country level data are available from the  `World Bank Waste Database <https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/search/dataset/0039597>`_. Additional regional defaults are available in V5, C2, Table 2.1 of IPCC GNGHGI  for default rates by region.

Variable: Per GDP Industrial Solid Waste Generated
Information: Industrial waste generated per GDP

Emissions from anaerobic decomposition organic waste in biogas plants. This waste stream flow is used to generate energy. Note that methane leakage from these plants is assumed to be 5% with a range of 0 - 10 % (see 2006 IPCC GHG guidance Volume 5, Chapter 4, page 4.4)
Total :math:`\text{CH}_4` emissions from incineration (combined MSW and ISW)
Total :math:`\text{CO}_2` emissions from incineration (combined MSW and ISW)
Total :math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}` emissions from incineration (combined MSW and ISW)

Biogas is a mixture of methane, carbon dioxide, water vapor, hydrogen suflide, and other gases. See `The EPA <https://www.epa.gov/agstar/how-does-anaerobic-digestion-work>`_ for an overview of anaerobic digestion and biogas.
Mass of methane recovered from landfill gas that is colleted.
Total quantity of industrial solid waste that is recovered for energy use.
Total quantity of municipal solid waste that is recovered for energy use.
Total quantity of waste sent to anaerobic biogas facilities.
Total quantity of waste composted in tonnes.
Total quantity of waste recycled in tonnes.
